TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {80660=§ 2322 - Repealed., 77268=§ 2303 - Applicability of chapter, 80451=§ 2320 - Rights in technical data, 78907=§ 2307 - Contract financing, 81126=§ 2324 - Allowable costs under defense contracts, 19477=DoD, GSA, and NASA are issuing a final rule amending the Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR) to strengthen protections against trafficking in persons in Federal contracts. These changes are intended to implement Executive Order (E.O.) 13627, entitled “Strengthening Protections Against Trafficking in Persons in Federal Contracts,” and title XVII of the National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2013., 79443=§ 2312 - Remission of liquidated damages, 82188=§ 2332 - Share-in-savings contracts, 80252=§ 2318 - Advocates for competition, 79103=§ 2309 - Allocation of appropriations, 79202=§ 2310 - Determinations and decisions, 9058=DoD, GSA, and NASA are issuing corrections to the Technical Amendments; (Item III), which was published in the Federal Register at 80 FR 4994, January 29, 2015., 76719=§ 2302 - Definitions, 81799=§ 2330 - Procurement of contract services: management structure, 140344=DoD, GSA, and NASA are proposing to amend the Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR) to implement a section of the National Defense Authorization Act (NDAA) for Fiscal Year (FY) 2013 to include in the Federal Awardee Performance and Integrity Information System (FAPIIS), to the extent practicable, identification of any immediate owner or subsidiary, and all predecessors of an offeror that held a Federal contract or grant within the last three years. The objective is to provide a more comprehensive understanding of the performance and integrity of the corporation before awarding a Federal contract., 145808=DoD, GSA, and NASA are proposing to amend the Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR) to further implement the inflation adjustment of acquisition-related dollar thresholds. A statute requires an adjustment every five years of acquisition-related thresholds for inflation using the Consumer Price Index for all urban consumers, except for the Construction Wage Rate Requirements statute (Davis-Bacon Act), Service Contract Labor Standards statute, and trade agreements thresholds. DoD, GSA, and NASA are also proposing to use the same methodology to adjust nonstatutory FAR acquisition-related thresholds in 2015., 78468=§ 2306 - Kinds of contracts, 81326=§ 2326 - Undefinitized contractual actions: restrictions, 79769=§ 2314 - Laws inapplicable to agencies named in, 80172=§ 2317 - Repealed., 79301=§ 2311 - Assignment and delegation of procurement functions and responsibilities, 80348=§ 2319 - Encouragement of new competitors, 77445=§ 2304 - Contracts: competition requirements, 82695=§ 2336 - Intergovernmental support agreements with State and local governments, 79878=§ 2315 - Law inapplicable to the procurement of automatic data processing equipment and services for certain defense purposes, 81571=§ 2328 - Release of technical data under Freedom of Information Act: recovery of costs, 78996=§ 2308 - Buy-to-budget acquisition: end items, 81719=§ 2329 - Repealed., 81444=§ 2327 - Contracts: consideration of national security objectives, 82043=§ 2331 - Procurement of services: contracts for professional and technical services, 81236=§ 2325 - Restructuring costs, 82458=§ 2334 - Independent cost estimation and cost analysis, 82285=§ 2333 - Joint policies on requirements definition, contingency program management, and contingency contracting, 79545=§ 2313 - Examination of records of contractor, 80065=§ 2316 - Disclosure of identity of contractor, 80546=§ 2321 - Validation of proprietary data restrictions, 76639=§ 2301 - Repealed., 13949=DoD, GSA, and NASA are issuing a correction to FAR Case 2014-008; Ending Trafficking in Persons (Item I), which was published in the Federal Register at 80 FR 4967, January 29, 2015., 82835=§ 2337 - Life-cycle management and product support, 78224=§ 2305 - Contracts: planning, solicitation, evaluation, and award procedures, 55270=DoD, GSA, and NASA are issuing a final rule amending the Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR) to delete obsolete regulations relating to the year 2000 compliance.}
